intro: Maesa naumanniana, commonly known as the African snowberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. It produces bright red berries that are edible for birds and small mammals. Maesa naumanniana thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
